properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Widespread thunderstorms are expected this afternoon. Some of these may become severe and produce strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-02T04:37:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T16:38:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4160674546.2019
Area: Chilcotin, Bulkley Valley, Lakes District
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Locally significant rainfall amounts possible... An area of low pressure will continue to bring scattered showers, heavy at times, and isolated thundershowers to northeastern mainland Nova Scotia and Cape Breton Island today. Additional rainfall amounts of up to 30 mm are possible in the heaviest showers by Tuesday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-01T21:23:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T13:24:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0485135560.2019
Area: Pictou County, Guysborough County, Antigonish County, Richmond County, Inverness County - south of Mabou, Inverness County - Mabou and north, Sydney Metro and Cape Breton County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and large hail. ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-02T03:22:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T15:22:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0416367770.2019
Area: Joutel - Matagami area, Miquelon - Desmaraisville area, James Bay and La Grande River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts to 90 kilometres per hour, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This severe thunderstorm is 30 kilometres west of Moosonee and travelling eastward at 50 kilometres per hour. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-01T22:30:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T19:32:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3204265081.2019
Area: Moosonee
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 3:33 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts and up to nickel size hail. A severe thunderstorm located near Kwataboahegan lake is moving southeastward at 45 km/h towards the Matagami River. This storm is capable of producing large hail and wind gusts up to 90 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-01T22:32:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T19:34:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3412823769.2019
Area: Fraserdale - Pledger Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts and large hail. As a cold front traverses Saskatchewan today, thunderstorms are developing along the front. Over west-central and southwestern Saskatchewan, some of these thunderstorms may become severe. The cold front will be tracking rapidly across Saskatchewan, so the weather may change quickly. Stay alert for updated bulletins as the watch area may be extended later today. Also of note, this cold front will bring a change in weather conditions as it pulls down cooler air from the arctic. Expect gusty northwesterly winds and cooler temperatures behind the cold front. Cooler temperatures will persist for the next few days. ### Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-02T05:16:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T19:37:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0741536050.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 1:23 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. The thunderstorm is located 30 km northeast of Manyberries and is moving to the northeast at 35 km/h. ### Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-01T22:22:00-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 1:37 p.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This thunderstorm is near Duperow and is moving northeast at 40 km/h. ### Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-01T22:36:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T19:38:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1504071495.2019
Area: R.M. of Biggar including Biggar and Springwater, R.M. of Mountain View including Herschel and Stranraer, R.M. of Marriott south of Biggar
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant rainfall possible tonight. Rain continues tonight and will give total amounts between 20 and 40 mm by Tuesday morning. However, due to some isolated pockets of heavier rain, totals could reach as high as 60 mm over some areas. The public is advised to be prepared for heavy downpours, especially with regards to travel or outdoor activities for this Canada Day evening. Rain is expected to taper to showers and drizzle by Tuesday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-07-02T02:09:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T18:10:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3848057149.2019
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, Avalon Peninsula Southeast, St. John's and vicinity, Avalon Peninsula Southwest, Burin Peninsula, Connaigre, Burgeo - Ramea, Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity, Clarenville and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and large hail. Thunderstorms are expected to develop this afternoon and may continue through the evening. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-07-02T03:21:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T15:22:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1347969570.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Thunderstorms will continue to develop in southeast Alberta this afternoon and Montana. Some of the thunderstorms that develop in Montana will also move into southeast Alberta as well. The main threat for severe thunderstorms will diminish late this afternoon. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-02T01:59:40-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T19:36:40-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1050888986.2019
Area: Co. of Forty Mile near Foremost, Co. of Forty Mile near Etzikom and Maleb, Co. of Forty Mile near Orion and Manyberries, Cypress Co. near Cypress Hills Prov. Park and Cressday, Co. of Forty Mile near Aden and Kennedy Coulee, Cypress Co. near Onefour and Wild Horse
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 1:28 p.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This thunderstorm is crossing the Alberta border near Fort Walsh and is moving northeast at 35 km/h. ### Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-01T22:27:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T19:29:14-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2008166399.2019
Area: R.M. of Maple Creek including Cypress Hills Prov. Park, R.M. of Reno including Consul Robsart and Willow Creek
properties.Author: Environment Canada

This thunderstorm is near Eatonia and is moving northeast at 40 km/h. ### Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Rain will continue over Victoria County tonight. Additional rainfall amounts of up to 25 mm are expected by Tuesday morning. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-02T10:41:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T18:42:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1370961907.2019
Area: Victoria County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged heat event expected this week. A hot and humid airmass has moved into the Windsor and Chatham area and is expected to remain in place this week. Maximum daytime temperatures of 31 degrees are possible with overnight minimum temperatures likely remaining near 21 degrees providing little relief from the heat. Scattered showers or thunderstorms expected Tuesday onward could prevent maximum daytime highs from reaching 31 degrees. However, maximum humidex values are still expected to be near 40. The hot and humid conditions are expected to remain in the area until the weekend. A cold front is expected to move through on Saturday and bring cooler conditions to the area. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-02T11:20:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T19:21:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0505831988.2019
Area: Chatham-Kent - Rondeau Park, Windsor - Leamington - Essex County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and large hail. Thunderstorms are expected to develop this afternoon and may continue through the evening. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-07-02T03:21:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-01T15:22:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3326976532.2019
